solution_line_template: Jake has to descend {steps_per_floor} steps on {num_floors} floors for a total of {num_floors}*{steps_per_floor} = <<{steps_per_floor}*{num_floors}={total_steps_jake}>>{total_steps_jake} steps

He descends {jake_descent_rate} steps every second so he will descend {total_steps_jake} steps in {total_steps_jake}/{jake_descent_rate} = <<{total_steps_jake}/{jake_descent_rate}={jake_time_seconds}>>{jake_time_seconds} seconds.

Austin will get down after only a minute ({elevator_time_seconds} seconds) so Jake will get down {jake_time_seconds}-{elevator_time_seconds} = <<{jake_time_seconds}-{elevator_time_seconds}={time_difference}>>{time_difference} seconds later.
